titles.title: B-Project: Kodou Ambitious
B-PROJECT 鼓動*アンビシャス
B-Project
B-PROJECT～鼓动＊Ambitious～

anime.description: The anime`s story follows Tsubasa, a new hire in the A&R department of the major recording company Gandala Music. Tsubasa is immediately assigned to oversee the idol unit "B-PROJECT," which is made up of three idol groups: Kitakore, Thrive, and MooNs. This is Tsubasa`s first job, and she gets involved in various incidents and accidents as she deals with this group of young men who each have their own differing personalities. Source: ANN

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: episodic
tag.description: An episodic anime consists of many successive short arcs that are generally 1-2 episodes in length, with strong plot continuity within each arc but generally little continuity from one arc to the next. For long shows (well upwards of 50 episodes), the episode count constraint is less tight; for example, a show with close to 250 episodes would also be considered episodic if it consisted of a majority of arcs of up to 3 or maybe 4 episodes and possibly also very few slightly longer arcs.

episode.title: BREAK OUT STAR
Break Out Star
Break Out Star
episode.summary: B-PROJECT is scheduled to perform at the large-scale outdoor music festival "RAIZIN Festival." As the boys enjoy a relaxed mood following the previous day`s perfect rehearsal, they`re informed the equipment onstage has been rearranged, preventing them from using the stage formation they had planned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BRILLIANTで行こう☆
Let`s Go With Brilliant
Brilliant de Ikou
episode.summary: MooNs has arrived at a campsite in the mountains to shoot a commercial for "Star Curry." Because this is the first time one of their songs will be used in a commercial, the members are exited and getting along well. The director Ninomiya expects much from the boys, but the rest of his staff are skeptical. When Tsubasa hears them talking about MooNs, she hopes the job will teach them just how great MooNs is. However, while the shoot starts off well, a problem suddenly occurs. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BAD ENDも悪くない
The Bad End Isn`t So Bad
Bad End mo Warukunai
episode.summary: During THRIVE`s production meeting for their new song, Kaneshiro expresses dissatisfaction over the song`s arrangement. He`s unable to see the point in pandering to fans any more than necessary. Meanwhile, THRIVE is hired for a gravure shoot for idol magazine "Kiss & Hug." When the chief editor Yoko Suzuki orders him to wear cat ears and make a kitty cat pose, Ashu and Aizome comply, but unable to stand it, Kaneshiro leaves the building. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BOYS MEET GIRL
Boys Meet Girl
Boys Meet Girl
episode.summary: Gandara Music`s new A&R Sumisora Tsubasa is assigned to work with the three-group and ten-man idol unit "B-PROJECT." Meeting the boys for the first time while they`re rehearsing for a music program, she`s immediately toyed with and tossed about by the quirky members of B-PROJECT. Next she accompanies Kitakore, one the groups, to the recording session of their new song. Tsubasa is enchanted by the voices of Kitakado and Korekuni, but during the song, she notices something is off. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BYE-BYE YESTERDAY
Bye-Bye Yesterday
Bye-Bye Yesterday
episode.summary: The ten members of B-PROJECT have come to a tropical island to take pictures for their fan book. During the shoot, they are suddenly assailed by a storm, and the cruiser carrying the members is swept away. After the storm disperses, the members find themselves on a desert island. Unable to get in touch with Tsubasa or the film crew, Masunaga exercises his leadership skills by assigning jobs to the other members so they can wait to be rescued in security and safety. However, his own eyes are directed towards Kitakado`s back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 胸のBULLET
Bullet of the Heart
Mune no Bullet
episode.summary: Kitakado, Masunaga, Aizome, Osari, and Nome head to tourist destination "Hakozaki" for an on location shoot as reporters for information variety program "Brunch Genius". The five boys split into the ocean team and mountain team to conduct their reports. While working on the ocean team, Aizome notices certain ill feelings between Kitakado and Masunaga. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: SIX SENSE BLADE
Six Sense Blade
Six Sense Blade
episode.summary: Kanehisor, Onzai, and Sekimura are chosen to appear in "Shinsengumi Ultimate" starring Matsukura Kenzo, and they are made to attend a workshop for all actors designed to select the actor who will play Okita Soji. During practice, actor Wakaoji Ryunosuke`s attitude suddenly changes when he picks up a bamboo sword equipped with Kiku-ichimonji Norimune, the sword guard Okita is said to have used. Onzai senses something behind the change in his behavior. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BACK TO THE BABY
Back to the Baby
Back to the Baby
episode.summary: B-PROJECT starts gaining attention after their performance at the RAIZIN Festival. They begin getting more work, and the members becoming increasingly positive about working together as a ten-man unit. An article on major actor Matsukura Kenzo`s romantic scandal is printed in a magazine. Korekuni is troubled to see his father Matsukura be the subject of gossip. When a persistent paparazzi looking for more information on Matsukura comes to Korekuni, he recalls the time he spent at the training school Bambi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: B-PROJECT~特番＊プレミアム~
B-Project: Special Episode Premium
B-Project: Tokuban Premium
episode.summary: A special behind the scene episode. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BOYS BE AMBITIOUS!
Boys Be Ambitious!
Boys Be Ambitious!
episode.summary: Tsubasa and the members of B-PROJECT learn through the news that they`re being transferred to Highedge Records. In order to obtain an explanation, Tsubasa tries to find Yashamaru. With no clues to his location and at a total loss, when Tsubasa spots Yashamaru on a crowded street, she suddenly receives a phone call. The shocking words that come from Yashamaru leave Tsubasa stunned. Meanwhile, while Tsubasa is out, the members of B-PRO are filled in on the truth about the transfer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BEYOND YOU
Beyond You
Beyond You
episode.summary: With their end of year B-PROJECT JAPAN Dome concert approaching, the members of B-PRO enthusiastically work together to plan a comprehensive concert. Meanwhile, the busy Yashamaru remains absent and unable to meet with Tsubasa or the members. Tsubasa begins to feel that something is off as she encounters one puzzling problem after another on B-PRO`s jobs. Later, the song the group was meant to debut at the Dome is heard playing in the city...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BIRTHDAY
Birthday
Birthday
episode.summary: Since they`ve started appearing frequently in movies, TV, and radio programs and getting more exposure in magazines and ads, the whole world seems to be talking about B-PRO. Amidst their rising popularity, Yashamaru tells them that they`ve been scheduled for a concert at the JAPAN Dome on New Year`s Eve. Tsubasa and the members are B-PRO are overjoyed to have their dream of performing at the Dome finally come true. They immediately being preparing for the concert while also planning a surprise birthday party for Yashamaru, who has supported B-PRO since its formation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 浮気なPLAY BOY
Flirtatious Play Boy
Uwaki na Play Boy
episode.summary: Kitakore and THRIVE are cast to star in world famous french director Sophie Vebelle`s new movie "Les chiens aboient." With the movie premiering worldwide, the boys are naturally excited. Despite being cast in the leading role, Aizomem is his usual self. When Tsubasa says they should work together to make the movie a success, he coolly responds that idols only think of themselves. However, the directors sees through him... Source: crunchyroll
